Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Statuette
Description: This statuette resembles the head of a nail. The widest edge is pierced by seven holes, which were used to insert strings (some fragments of which still survive). These strings undoubtedly represented hair. The clay was pinched along a distance of 1,5 cm to form a ridge, creating the nose. On either side of this ridge, two fine horizontal incisions represent the eyes.
